intro: Salix helvetica var. subconcolor, commonly known as the white willow. This variant of the white willow is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and slender, drooping branches. It is a deciduous tree that typically grows in moist, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth margin, often turning yellow in the fall. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in wetland environments and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
